title: Atlanta man accidentally shot and killed by brother during hunting trip
content:
A 30-year-old man was shot and killed Saturday by his brother while hunting in South Carolina.
According to AJC.com, Atlanta native Brian Pickle was shot by his sibling, Scott Leonard Pickle, when the latter mistook the other for a doe or coyote, the Union County Sheriff, David Taylor, said on Tuesday.
The brothers’ father was also a member of the hunting party, AJC notes.
The accident took place just before nightfall, around 6 p.m. Saturday. It occurred on land leased for hunting, AJC writes.
As darkness fell around the hunting party, Scott said he felt limited in time to take a shot, AJC.com notes, and never thought that what he did fire at could be a person.
Taylor said these sorts of accidents occur far too frequently.
The autopsy showed a gunshot wound to the head, coroner William Holcombe confirmed.
The South Carolina Department of Natural Resources is investigating the matter.
